intro: Nashia inaguensis, commonly known as the Inagua napoleonic, is a flowering plant native to the Bahamas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
